item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 25, 2025 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Claude Code (1315 points | 589 comments)
2. Everyone at NSF overseeing the Platforms for Wireless Experimentation is gone (140 points | 85 comments)
3. It's still worth blogging in the age of AI (81 points | 44 comments)
4. "The closer to the train station, the worse the kebab" – a "study" (195 points | 199 comments)
5. Clean Code vs. A Philosophy Of Software Design (68 points | 33 comments)
6. Show HN: I built an app to stop me doomscrolling by touching grass (974 points | 240 comments)
7. While the world builds AI Agents, I'm just building calculators (9 points | 6 comments)
8. Introduction to Stochastic Calculus (317 points | 62 comments)
9. Closing the "green gap": energy savings from the math of the landscape function (68 points | 28 comments)
10. Breaking into apartment buildings in five minutes on my phone (289 points | 182 comments)
11. The best way to use text embeddings portably is with Parquet and Polars (138 points | 37 comments)
12. Launch HN: SubImage (YC W25) – See your infra from an attacker's perspective (97 points | 22 comments)
13. Writing a DSL in Lua (2015) (60 points | 14 comments)
14. AI cracks superbug problem in two days that took scientists years (186 points | 88 comments)
15. Only bad poems go viral (36 points | 39 comments)
16. Show HN: I made a site to tell the time in corporate (187 points | 90 comments)
17. Microsoft cancels leases for AI data centers, analyst says (338 points | 275 comments)
18. Neut Programming Language (125 points | 32 comments)
19. Modular forms, the 'fifth fundamental operation' of math (2023) (62 points | 4 comments)
20. Right to Repair laws have now been introduced in all 50 us states (405 points | 125 comments)
21. Student refines 100-year-old math problem, expanding wind energy possibilities (102 points | 13 comments)
22. Keeping our free tier sustainable by preventing abuse (65 points | 26 comments)
23. Micro Journal: Distraction-Free Writing Device (73 points | 33 comments)
24. Show HN: Electro – A hyper-fast Windows image viewer with a built-in terminal (36 points | 22 comments)
25. Ashby (YC W19) Is Hiring Principal Product Engineers ( | hide)
26. Is this the simplest (and most surprising) sorting algorithm ever? (2021) (96 points | 91 comments)
27. Apple says it will add 20k jobs, spend $500B, produce AI servers in US (534 points | 517 comments)
28. Why does target="_blank" have an underscore in front? (2024) (251 points | 178 comments)
29. Vialess heterogeneous skin patch for multimodal monitoring and stimulation (10 points | discuss)
30. I ate and reviewed every snack in our office kitchen (72 points | 55 comments)
